data.description: Heuristics to identify weblogs from raw HTML
data.PS: The following links are only valid for module list maintainers:
data.rationale:
In building a blog search engine, I noticed there was no Perl
    module for distinguising weblogs from regular Web pages. Blogs have
    many distinctive features that make it possible to identify them by
    examining clues in the raw HTML. The goal of this module is to
    provide a good identification rate, as well as utility methods like
    the ability to identify boundaries between posts, find the blogroll,
    RDF resources, and so on. The goal is to provide a useful place to
    accumulate blog scraping code / wisdom.
